top_categories.workout_context: 67ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
At Grassroots Gravel, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Grassroots Gravel. Train it until it feels boring.
Grassroots Gravel's Colorado rolling, Local event forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 60 miles.
When someone attacks on Colorado rolling gravel, you have 10 seconds to respond or you're off the back. This builds that response.
Varied gradients on Colorado rolling gravel demand climbing versatility. Sit the shallow stuff, stand the steep stuff, switch without thinking.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Grassroots Gravel's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before October.
Double-threshold training builds sustained power with less fatigue. More FTP per hour of training.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Grassroots Gravel, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
60 miles on Colorado rolling gravel burns energy faster than the distance suggests. Train the fade resistance now.
Base fitness for Grassroots Gravel. Without this, the hard workouts break you down instead of building you up.
Low-cadence force work for 4,000ft of climbing. The slow, grinding ascents where you can't spin—you push.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Grassroots Gravel’s 60 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at Grassroots Gravel. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Grassroots Gravel requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on colorado rolling gravel to build confidence. Expect: colorado rolling, local event, mountain west gravel.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, Over Under, and G Spot to prepare you for 60 miles of colorado rolling gravel in Pueblo, Colorado.
